outputs.output_descr:
The Resident Coordinator/Humanitarian Coordinator, is in charge of numerous actions that require integration and coordination between the Mission and the UN Country Team. This Section in UNMISS is responsible for liaison with the UN Country Team, under functions captured by the Resident Coordinator's Support Office (RCSO).
In the past two years, the RCSO's main priorities have been to establish coherent basic coordination structures, extend its presence through the deployment of RRP UNMISS staffs into each of the 10 States to respond to humanitarian emergencies (in the absence of state-level OCHA officers) and ensure implementation of the UN Country Team's portfolios (humanitarian action, protection of civilians, stabilization and state take-off).
In South Sudan, the RCSO consists of both UNDP and UNMISS staff, ensuring coordination between the UN Mission and UN Agencies, Funds and Programmes.
The RCSO provides support to the strategic, programmatic and operational coordination of the UN Agencies, Funds and Programmes and ensures coordination with the UN Peacekeeping Mission. The RCSO further ensures coordination with the Government, NGOs and the Donor Community. Lastly, the RCSO supports the RC/HC and the UN Country Team through the coordination and implementation of a joint communication and resource mobilization strategy.
outputs.output_title: Support to UN RC/HC in S.Sudan

project_descr: Support to UN RC/HC functions in the South Sudan.
project_title: Support to UN RC/HC in South Sudan
